Package it.polimi.ingsw.model.player

Class Execution

  • java.lang.Object
    • it.polimi.ingsw.model.player.Execution
  • public class Execution
extends java.lang.Object
    An Execution is an ordered list of Activitys the Player can perform during their turn. On each turn, a Player can normally perform two Executions, except when they use frenetic actions.

      • generateMove

        private static Execution generateMove​(Player subject)
        Generates an Execution using the Move Activity, based on the condition of the Player passed as argument.
        Parameters:
        subject - The Player for whom this method needs to generate the Execution.
        Returns:
        The Execution deemed correct for the Player, given their status.
        See Also:
        Move

      • generateGrab

        private static Execution generateGrab​(Player subject)
        Generates an Execution using the Move and Grab Activitys, based on the condition of the Player passed as argument.
        Parameters:
        subject - The Player for whom this method needs to generate the Execution.
        Returns:
        The Execution deemed correct for the Player, given their status.
        See Also:
        Move, Grab

      • generateShoot

        private static Execution generateShoot​(Player subject)
        Generates an Execution using the Shoot Activity, occasionally coupled with the Move and/or Reload Activitys, based on the condition of the Player passed as argument.
        Parameters:
        subject - The Player for whom this methods needs to generate the Execution.
        Returns:
        The Execution deemed correct for the Player, given their status.
        See Also:
        Move, Shoot, Reload

      • concatenateReload

        private static void concatenateReload​(java.util.List<Activity> activityList,
                                      Player subject)
        This method takes in a list of Activity (the soon-to-be Execution) and a Player. If the Player is not on final frenzy and they are about to perform the last Execution of their turn, the option to Reload a Weapon at the end is added. This is achieved by concatenating a Reload Activity at the end of the list of Activitys passed in as argument. Should the Player not meet the requirements to be able to Reload at the end of the Execution, this method will have no effect on the Activity list.
        Parameters:
        activityList - The list of Activitys that will shortly be turned into an Execution.
        subject - The Player for whom to evaluate whether or not to allow a Reload at the end of their turn.

      • getOptionsForPlayer

        public static java.util.List<Execution> getOptionsForPlayer​(Player subject)
        Generates a list of Executions based on a Player's current condition.
        Parameters:
        subject - The Player for whom to generate a list of options.
        Returns:
        A list of Executions from which the Player will pick one to perform.
